00228    private:
00229 
00230       /*
00231       * Struct containing an Atom* pointer and cell id for that atom.
00232       *
00233       * The CellList::placeAtom(&Atom) method calculates the cell rank
00234       * for an atom, and stores the rank and a pointer in an AtomTag.
00235       * It also increments the number of atoms in the relevant cell.
00236       * The number of atoms in each cell is known only after a loop
00237       * over all atoms. The CellList::build() method then sorts the
00238       * Atom* pointers into contiguous blocks of the handles_ array.
00239       */
00240       struct AtomTag 
00241       {
00242          Atom* handle;
00243          int cellRank;
00244       };
00245 
00247       Cell::OffsetArray offsets_;
00248 
00250       Grid   grid_;
00251 
00253       DArray<AtomTag> tags_;
00254 
00256       DArray<Atom*>   handles_;
00257 
00259       DArray<Cell>  cells_;
00260 
00262       Vector  lower_; 
00263 
00265       Vector  upper_; 
00266 
00268       Vector  cellLengths_; 
00269 
00271       Vector  lowerOuter_; 
00272 
00274       Vector  upperOuter_; 
00275 
00277       Cell* begin_;
00278 
00280       int nAtom_;
00281 
00283       int nReject_;
00284 
00286       bool isBuilt_;
00287 
00288       /*
00289       * Calculate required dimensions for cell grid.
00290       *
00291       * Called internally by allocate and makeGrid. Does not link cells or
00292       * calculate offsets to neighbors.
00293       *
00294       * \param lower    lower bound used to allocate array of cells.
00295       * \param uppper   upper bound used to allocate array of cells.
00296       * \param cutoff   minimum dimension of a cell in any direction
00297       */
00298       void setGridDimensions(const Vector& lower, const Vector& upper, 
00299                              double cutoff);
00300 
00304       bool isValidAtomId(int atomId)
00305       { return ( (0 <= atomId) && (atomId < tags_.capacity()) ); }
00306 
00307    }; 
00308 
00309    // Public inline method definitions:
00310 
00311    /*
00312    * Identify the cell for an Atom, based on its position.
00313    */
00314    inline int CellList::cellIndexFromPosition(const Vector& position) const
00315    {
00316       IntVector r;
00317       for (int i = 0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00318          if (position[i] < lowerOuter_[i]) {
00319             return -1;
00320          }
00321          if (position[i] > upperOuter_[i]) {
00322             return -1;
00323          }
00324          if (position[i] < lower_[i]) {
00325             r[i] = 0;
00326          } else {
00327             r[i] = int( (position[i] - lower_[i])/ cellLengths_[i] ) + 1;
00328          }
00329          assert(r[i] < grid_.dimension(i));
00330       }
00331       return grid_.rank(r);
00332    }
00333 
00334    /*
00335    * Add an Atom to the appropriate cell, based on its position.
00336    */
00337    inline void CellList::placeAtom(Atom &atom)
00338    {
00339       // Preconditon
00340       assert(nAtom_ < tags_.capacity());
00341 
00342       int rank = cellIndexFromPosition(atom.position());
00343       if (rank >= 0) {
00344          tags_[nAtom_].cellRank = rank;
00345          tags_[nAtom_].handle = &atom;
00346          cells_[rank].incrementCapacity();
00347          ++nAtom_;
00348       } else {
00349          ++nReject_;
00350       }
00351    }
00352 
00353    inline const Grid& CellList::grid() const
00354    {  return grid_; }
00355 
00356    inline double CellList::cellLength(int i) const
00357    {  return cellLengths_[i]; }
00358 
00359    inline const Cell& CellList::cell(int i) const
00360    {  return cells_[i]; }
00361 
00362    inline const Cell* CellList::begin() const
00363    {  return begin_; }
00364 
00365    inline bool CellList::isAllocated() const
00366    {  return (cells_.capacity() > 0); }
